My recommendation is to see the movie first before you buy it.

This is a movie that requires you to sit and watch. NO leaving the room for more soda or pop corn or you will get lost! This is not your usual muscle man/beat'em up movie. It's a thought provoker, which is what I like about this movie. But you still get the action that Mark Dacascos is famous for...but he gets to stretch his acting muscles too. As for the title I chose for my review, it's as thought provoking as the movie.  In the end; this is the choice that Mark's character(Father Luke) must make! After renting it,  bought it!

This film has an excellent story line. Intrigue @ the CIA level,with an unprecedented drive for power control. The plot line was terrific,by training young children into becoming assassins. The acting was lacking somewhat,having only a few recognizable actors,although Mark Decoscos is a bonified action hero. If this film had a better supporting cast,the film have become a box office winner. I'd highly recommend this film for people who love intrigue& action packed movies with a twist.

Amazon Prime Included Film: The Plot has several major twists & turns; just enough to be sure that you are not ever quite certain  "Who Are" the Good vs Bad Guys. The underlying theme of Atonement is an ongoing challenging process for the films protagonist; "Father John"; aka: Luke, Former CIA Black Ops specialist; despite his vows and new life as a Parish Priest in Chicago. The "Hook" of "Reaping what one sows" is also played out to the very end; with Father John once again having to face a major life-turning decision; and one is left with the sense of "What Would I Do" if in his same shoes ....  Quite a Clever Film produced in 1998. I give this a 4 star due to the fact that this film; as are what; 90-95% of Mystery-Suspense-Thriller movies for too many years; was filmed in very Low Lighting and Sound; making it difficult to see & hear details clearly; no matter how many adjustments I made to my screen.

This film was exciting, filled with action and suspense. Mark Dacascos plays a priest with a past. The film starts with Mark being interrogated, but we do not know who is asking the questions or why. Little by little we learn about his past and why he took the vows of a priest. The film has a startling ending that will cause viewers to rethink what they had seen and decide what happens next.

I enjoyed this action secret agent thriller with government intrigue and a twisting plot.  The action scenes were good.  The characters were mostly kind of single sided; but the star was a complex character.  The script and dialog was good and delivery was pretty smooth and professional.  I didn't know about the star's fighting abilities until I read the other reviews after I saw the movie.  The music was OK.  Lots of killing.  I liked that in the one scene where they could have had some nudity, they didn't do it (though the stopping short was in line with the main character's new and developing personality.  It's the kind of a movie that, now that I know the plot, I won't want to see it again for a year or so.  One of the other reviews says that you better not leave the room or you'll miss something and not understand what's going.  It's true.  This is not a casually viewed movie.  You have to pay attention or you'll get lost.  I like it and recommend it for adults.

Actor Mark Dacascos was the perfect fit. You need to keep your eyes wide open all the time as you watch this 3 dimensional fiction or you will miss it. How the CIA Clandestine services operates and expects those employed to always be a sacrificial lamb when required appears to be a part of the plot. Be assured though, the action is straight to the point and the plot takes several turns, including an unexpected finale. It might make one wonder, "...is there another plot in the writers mind that will be covered in a follow up.." say a Sanctuary II? ....Sanctuary CLASSIFIED: For Your Eyes Only ( for the moment )

Luke Kovak (Mark Dacascos), a CIA hit man, joins the Catholic church and calls himself Father John, all the while helping the poor and the homeless. High political interests are desirous of returning Luke to their fold. What transpires is a series of murders and bombings that rival any action movie. The storyline is solid and the acting is above average. Four Stars.
Having been raised a Catholic, the ending was not that much of a surprise. It was more like, "But of course!"
I don't doubt this one bit.  ;)

I concede that I will be watching movies that are in all modes. This one was 4:3. It wasn't 5.1 surround but that, too, no longer bothers me. The story was very interesting. The violence was excellent. It was shooting. It was exploding. There was kicking and punching. There was some reading at the beginning and ending but it was relevant. The bulk of the movie was in English and it was originally made in English. This movie was a recommendation by Amazon Prime for me. Amazon has apparently realized that I don't require HD; I just require a good action story.
